stimulusHtml: If f is a continuous function on the closed interval [a, b], which of the following must be true?
choicesHtml: There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that f (c) = 0.
There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that f (a) < f (c) < f (b).
There is a number c in the closed interval [a, b] such that f (c) ≥ f (x) for all x in [a, b].

There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that f ′ ( c ) = 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E63@

There is a number c in the open interval (a b) such that f ′ ( c ) = f ( b ) − f ( a ) b − a MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4891@ .
